text: Madiya Beth Harriott (born February 16, 1999) is an American-born Jamaican footballer who plays as a defender for Vanderbilt Commodores and the Jamaica women's national team. ==Early life and education== Harriott attends Vanderbilt University in Nashville, Tennessee. ==International career== Harriott qualifies to play for Jamaica through her father. She has represented the Caribbean nation on the senior national team as well as the under-20 national team. She competed at the 2018 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Championship. She made her senior debut on 28 July 2019 against Mexico in the Pan American Games. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1999 births Category:Living people Category:Women's association football defenders Category:Jamaican women's footballers Category:Jamaica women's international footballers Category:Pan American Games competitors for Jamaica Category:Footballers at the 2019 Pan American Games Category:Jamaican people of American descent Category:American women's soccer players Category:Soccer players from Florida Category:Sportspeople from the Miami metropolitan area Category:People from Davie, Florida Category:African-American women's soccer players Category:American people of Jamaican descent Category:Vanderbilt Commodores women's soccer players
title: Madiya Harriott
